arg1.author: TheAlleycat
arg1.text: As humans, we cannot know exactly if there is a higher force or not. Christianity however is not it. Firstly because it is not one belief that every Christian shares, it lacks solidarity. I compare it to a road with all different kinds of sideways. Ask a question about religion, and lots of people will find one of those sideways to adjust their religion to their personal beliefs. With Atheïsm, the concept is pretty clear. It is more scientific, and I like that.

I compare it to a road with all different kinds of sideways. Ask a question about religion, and lots of people will find one of those sideways to adjust their religion to their personal beliefs.

With Atheïsm, the concept is pretty clear. It is more scientific, and I like that.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: BenWalters
arg2.text: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. Its teachings, written by an all powerful, all knowing, creator of the universe, are filled with contradictions. The arguments for Christianity just don't hold ground (bar one or two, and those are close). Atheism is not perfect, but it is the more logical position of the two.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: BlueShaman

With Atheïsm, the concept is pretty clear. It is more scientific, and I like that.

God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: Apollo
arg2.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg2.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg1.author: BlueShaman
arg1.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg1.author: BenWalters
arg1.text: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. Its teachings, written by an all powerful, all knowing, creator of the universe, are filled with contradictions. The arguments for Christianity just don't hold ground (bar one or two, and those are close). Atheism is not perfect, but it is the more logical position of the two.
arg1.originalHTML: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. Its teachings, written by an all powerful, all knowing, creator of the universe, are filled with contradictions. The arguments for Christianity just don't hold ground (bar one or two, and those are close). Atheism is not perfect, but it is the more logical position of the two.

The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A2 does actually have at least a small amount of actual argument. A1 is simply a social commentary.
A1 does not seem to be serious (i.e. using "lawl," all caps laughing) and attacks something irrelevant to the actual topic.
A1 doesn't list any facts to support their opinion. A2 contrasts the two religions and points out basic tenets of each one.
A2 seems to give reassons and not just an opinion.
A2 stated their points clearly and concisely.

arg1.author: Thejackster
arg1.text: Christianity: belief in rape, genocide, hell fire, unscientific claims, superstition, eternal torture, pedophilia, incest, matricide, infanticide, bestiality, talking donkeys, talking snakes, etc Atheism: the rejection of these claims based on logic, observation, and common sense
arg1.originalHTML:
Christianity: belief in rape, genocide, hell fire, unscientific claims, superstition, eternal torture, pedophilia, incest, matricide, infanticide, bestiality, talking donkeys, talking snakes, etc

Atheism: the rejection of these claims based on logic, observation, and common sense

arg2.author: Iamyoufather
arg2.text: Religion in the past has caused many wars. It encourages racism , sexism and homophobia. It is something that gives us prejudice. It makes us hate one another. the time has come to put a stop to it.

arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.
arg2.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg1.author: BenWalters
arg1.text: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. Its teachings, written by an all powerful, all knowing, creator of the universe, are filled with contradictions. The arguments for Christianity just don't hold ground (bar one or two, and those are close). Atheism is not perfect, but it is the more logical position of the two.

The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: They provide no facts is very biased.
mTurkAssignment.hitComment: Interesting survey! Thank You!

A1 makes the argument and opinions more clear
Both A1 and A2 rely solely on thier opinion.

arg1.author: BlueShaman
arg1.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.
arg1.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. arg2.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.
arg2.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg1.author: BenWalters
arg1.text: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. arg1.author: BlueShaman
arg1.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg1.author: BlueShaman
arg1.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

arg2.author: BenWalters
arg2.text: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.
arg2.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg2.author: Apollo
arg2.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg2.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

arg2.author: BenWalters
arg2.text: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. Its teachings, written by an all powerful, all knowing, creator of the universe, are filled with contradictions. The arguments for Christianity just don't hold ground (bar one or two, and those are close). Atheism is not perfect, but it is the more logical position of the two.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.
arg2.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg2.author: BenWalters
arg2.text: Christianity conflicts with historical, archaeological, astronomical, biological, and many other forms of evidence. It denies rational & impartial common sense. debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: Apollo
arg2.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg2.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

arg1.author: BlueShaman
arg1.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg1.author: BlueShaman
arg1.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.
arg1.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: The A2 argument is less reactionary, however it does not get to the heart of the issue
mTurkAssignment.hitComment: I am looking for employment, if you would like to hire me to help put together studies.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A2 debates things not in the topic
A2 tries to steer the reader in a direction that is not parallel to the topic at hand.
Neither one of them brought up any good points to stand by their argument.
A2 is more convincing because it approaches a more general concept in religion as opposed to A1 which uses a very weak argument.

arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.
arg2.originalHTML:
The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. arg2.author: Apollo
arg2.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg2.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: Both arguments sort of run in circles. Not sure either is better then each other.
neither one is providing any hard facts.

mTurkAssignment.hitComment: Argument in any of these cases has basis only when and if there is some facts to support the argument.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A1 does not specifically bring an argument against Christianity.
Neither are convincing. Both immediately jump to insults, which suggests they have no other way to defend their argument.

arg2.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. arg2.author: BlueShaman
arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

arg1.author: BlueShaman
arg1.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser.

There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

arg2.text: The greatest reason to find any given deity unreasonable is that you can replace it with one who has lied to humanity about literally everything it says, and we wouldn't be the wiser. What makes it even weaker is that you can also replace it with a series of lies of humans or hallucinations. There is no a single prophecy in the Bible, and certainly none that have come true.

I AM an atheist and im a good person. the idea that a mere belief difference can seal ones fate is beyond preposterous, its madness!!

I AM an atheist and im a good person. the idea that a mere belief difference can seal ones fate is beyond preposterous, its madness!!

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A1 and A2 both have valid points and valid arguments.
A1 takes a better tone - that is, not hysterical.
A1 uses the fact that there are no known facts in religion, making the argument strong and hard to compete against.
Argument A2 is too demeaning of Christians
A1 presents a more concise and coherent argument.

arg1.author: Apollo
arg1.text: Notmymuse, Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one. I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary. Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument). Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity. Once you have done this, disprove all other religions. - Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.
arg1.originalHTML:
Notmymuse,

Give me one logical reason to believe Christianity. Just one.

I have yet to see one gad damn shred of evidence for Christianity. I have also seen mountains of evidence to the contrary.

Once you have discredited ALL evidence against Christianity, create an argument for Christianity with empirical fact (or a damn solid priori argument).

Once you have done this, disprove ALL logical arguments against Christianity.

Once you have done this, disprove all other religions.

-

Until such a time that you have done ALL of these things, it is illogical to believe in this bible bullshit.

arg2.author: Saurbaby
arg2.text: I find most religions absolutely ridiculous and illogical, the only people who follow them are those who were brainwashed in childhood and really have no individual thought process. Most of the followers at least. Then there are theists who will twist ANY logic to fit their views. They're intelligent ones that you have to watch out for ;) I'm not an atheist by any means, but I'd rather call myself an atheist than a Christian. It allows for more logic in my mind.

debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A1 is not trying to prove his view, but instead trying to make you prove yours through an impossible set of requirements. A2 is Ad hominum.
Both do not state why their opinions are right with facts, they are mostly personal opinions demanding or from experience but no research to back up.
A2 makes a better argument. I think a1 could have added a bunch of facts instead of more gibberish.
Neither is convincing at all. They both just present personal opinions without any facts, both bashing the opposing side's view.
A2 is more a personal attack rather than a logical argument
